goals.question: What is the distribution of GDP per capita across different countries?
goals.visualization: Box plot of GDP per capita
goals.rationale: A box plot can show the median, quartiles, and outliers of the distribution of GDP per capita. This can help identify which countries have high or low GDP per capita and how they compare to each other.

goals.question: What is the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of life expectancy vs GDP per capita
goals.rationale: A scatter plot can show the relationship between two variables, in this case, life expectancy and GDP per capita. This can help identify if there is a positive or negative correlation between the two variables.

goals.question: What is the distribution of CO2 emissions per capita across different countries?
goals.visualization: Histogram of CO2 emissions per capita
goals.rationale: A histogram can show the frequency distribution of CO2 emissions per capita. This can help identify which countries have high or low CO2 emissions per capita and how they compare to each other.

goals.question: What is the trend of renewable energy consumption over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of renewable energy consumption over time
goals.rationale: A line chart can show the trend of renewable energy consumption over time. This can help identify if there is an increase or decrease in renewable energy consumption and how it compares to non-renewable energy consumption.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population across different regions?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of population by region
goals.rationale: A bar chart can show the population of each region. This can help identify which regions have the highest or lowest population and how they compare to each other.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.boxplot(data['GDP per capita'])
    plt.title('What is the distribution of GDP per capita across different countries?', wrap=True)
    plt.ylabel('GDP per capita')
    plt.xticks([1], ['Countries'])
    plt.axhline(data['GDP per capita'].median(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f"Median: {data['GDP per capita'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['GDP per capita'], data['life expectancy'])
    plt.xlabel('GDP per capita')
    plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['CO2_emissions_per_capita'] = data['CO2_emissions'] / data['population']
    plt.hist(data['CO2_emissions_per_capita'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='CO2 emissions per capita')
    plt.xlabel('CO2 emissions per capita')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of CO2 emissions per capita across different countries?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

    plt.plot(data['date'], data['renewable_energy_consumption'], label='Renewable Energy Consumption', color='green')
    plt.xlabel('Date')
    plt.ylabel('Renewable Energy Consumption')
    plt.title('What is the trend of renewable energy consumption over time?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Group data by region and calculate the sum of population
    grouped_data = data.groupby('region')['population'].sum().reset_index()

    # Create a bar chart
    plt.bar(grouped_data['region'], grouped_data['population'])

    # Set the title
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population across different regions?', wrap=True)

    # Set x-axis label
    plt.xlabel('Region')

    # Set y-axis label
    plt.ylabel('Population')

    # Rotate x-axis labels for better readability
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)

    # Add legend
    plt.legend(['Population'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
